name: Pdxdiy.github.com
body:
### PDX DIY is...
PDX DIY is part of [a global community of DIY clubs](https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=203379347826506982811.0004de47c074c006a4eab&msa=0&ie=UTF8&ll=24.396606,-0.993731&spn=61.243619,244.081567&t=m&source=embed). Also, [DIY is a community](https://diy.org/) where tens of thousands of kids get to share what they do and learn skills.

### What we do
PDX DIY club is a group that works together to practice skills (like [Bike Mechanic](https://diy.org/skills/bikemechanic)), do creative projects (like [make a game from scratch](https://diy.org/skills/salvager/challenges/64/make-a-game-from-scrap)) and take epic adventures together (like exploring the [Japanese Gardens](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_garden) while checking off [botanist skills](https://diy.org/skills/botanist)). We get together periodially and are just a bunch of friends hacking on random projects.

### How to join
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.

### Volunteer

We're currently seeking volunteers to help with our outreach efforts. Increasingly, we are involved in Maker Faires, museum programs, and other exciting events around the Portland Area. We're looking for folks interested in education and capable at building things to help us as we develop this program. Some volunteer tasks would include: sourcing materials, hands-on support at workshops, building life-size versions of this - just to name a few. If you're interested in helping out with any of this, please [fill out this form](http://eepurl.com/z4kfj).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
